data.title: The Pink Bow Campaign
data.text:
The Pink Bow Campaign, Inc. is a local non profit organization offering pink bows for individuals, businesses, neighborhoods, communities, and schools to "PINK OUT" their surroundings and show support for those fighting breast cancer. The pink bows are a symbol of hope and awareness and a visible reminder to schedule yearly mammograms and reinforce the message that early detection saves lives.

Our Whyâ€“

Founder, Robin Saddler, started The Pink Bow Campaign, Inc. in 2021 in honor of her mother, Mary Beth Hyatt, a 22-year breast cancer survivor.

Our Impact-

Support The Go Jen Go Foundation's mission to help those who are affected by the financial and emotional burden of a breast cancer diagnosis.

Support metastatic breast cancer patients (MBC) with an MBC Thriver Pink Bow and the mission of MBC Travelers to empower metastatic stage four breast cancer patients through bucket list travel.

Donate-A-Pink-Bow - Support breast cancer patients, survivors, and thrivers with pink bows and messages of hope throughout the year.

Adopt-A-Neighborhood - Support underserved communities by bringing pink bows and breast health information and awareness.

Since 2021-

Over $60,000 donated to Go Jen Go.

$5,000 donated to MBC Travelers.

More than 15,000 pink bows have been distributed.

Over 100 volunteers.

Reached almost 60 neighborhoods and 15,000 house holds.

Our Volunteers -

The Pink Bow Campaign is 100% dependent upon our amazing volunteers and supporters. We are dedicated to raising awareness and making a difference in our community and those affected by breast cancer. Volunteers give dollars, product, and/or time. There are opportunities for corporations, families, adults, and students in need of service hours to join our campaign and get involved throughout the year. The Pink Bow Campaign engages individuals and families who want a one-time or an ongoing volunteer opportunity.

The Pink Bow Campaign offers a unique opportunity to support a critical cause and be recognized for commitment to your local community in the fight against breast cancer. Together we can make and IMPACT, One pink bow at a time!
